text:
Hi <@UM5JQ5EUE> Yes, you're right it was selecting dynamic URL and where you've put an asterisks, it's a colon..
This was my exact entry that worked :slightly_smiling_face:
`/customer-success-stories-old/:*post-slug*`
`customer-success-stories/*{post-slug}*`

That's weird - documentation states that you can use an asterix to capture the remainder of the URL when no more components (:) are required. Don't know what that wouldn't work in this case. Your form should work also.
